The main purpose of creating a requirements traceability matrix is to track how requirements can be connected to the solution.

A requirements traceability matrix is a tool used by business analysts to establish and maintain the traceability of requirements throughout the project lifecycle. It provides a structured way to link requirements to their sources, such as business objectives, user needs, and stakeholder requirements. Additionally, it allows for tracing the relationships between different levels of requirements, such as high-level business requirements, functional requirements, and technical requirements.

questions.question_text: One of the main purposes for creating a requirements traceability matrix is to:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
When there is concern that key performance indicators (KPIs) may not validate the desired benefits, the business analyst should examine the assumptions made during the requirements and acceptance criteria definition. Assumptions are conditions believed to be true but not yet proven, and they often underlie the reasoning behind KPIs and success criteria. By documenting assumptions, the business analyst can clarify the context in which the KPIs were selected and identify any gaps or misalignments between the KPIs and the desired outcomes. This also provides a foundation for validating the assumptions later, ensuring they align with actual performance once the implementation occurs.
